issue.title: Aborting ignition-transport windows job can cause future jobs to fail

content.raw:
I don't know. I do know that [ign_transport-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat](#!/osrf/release-tools/src/cbd118c5e49cdb8fda5fa08992b5434425d008a0/jenkins-scripts/ign_transport-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#ign_transport-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat-5) defines `IGN_CLEAN_WORKSPACE=true`, which deletes the entire workspace folder.

It also occurs to me that when I tried to delete the workspace folder, I was unable because it said something was still using the folder. I then checked the task manager and found lingering test was still running. After I killed that test, I was able to delete the folder.

New theory: maybe it was actually failing during the parts of the script where it tries to delete the folder because of that zombie test?
content.html:
I don't know. I do know that ign_transport-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat defines IGN_CLEAN_WORKSPACE=true, which deletes the entire workspace folder.

It also occurs to me that when I tried to delete the workspace folder, I was unable because it said something was still using the folder. I then checked the task manager and found lingering test was still running. After I killed that test, I was able to delete the folder.

New theory: maybe it was actually failing during the parts of the script where it tries to delete the folder because of that zombie test?
